reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: to warn against the dangers of walking
to explain how cartilage functions under pressure
to compare the structure of different joints
to advertise a new treatment for knee pain
to describe the chemical properties of synovial fluid

answer.explanation: 이 글은 무릎과 같은 체중 부하 관절에서 연골이 어떻게 작동하는지에 초점을 맞추고 있습니다. 걷는 동안 압력이 가해지고 해제될 때 연골이 활액을 흡수하고 배출하는 과정을 설명하며, 이를 통해 압력에 대응하는 방식을 보여줍니다. 따라서 글의 주된 목적은 압력 하에서 연골이 어떻게 기능하는지를 설명하는 것입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: The Dangers of Synovial Fluid
How to Walk Without Hurting Your Knees
Cartilage: The Living Sponge in Your Joints
A Step-by-Step Guide to Joint Health
The Inner Workings of the Human Leg

answer.explanation: 이 글은 연골이 활액을 흡수하고 배출하는 기능을 '스펀지(sponge)'에 비유하여 설명하고 있습니다. 이 비유는 연골이 어떻게 압력에 대응하는지를 이해하는 핵심입니다. 따라서 '연골: 관절 속의 살아있는 스펀지'라는 제목이 글의 중심 내용을 가장 잘 나타냅니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Cartilage endures changing pressure by absorbing and squeezing out synovial fluid, much like a household sponge.
The primary function of cartilage is to permanently store synovial fluid within the knee joint for lubrication.
Walking puts a constant, unchanging amount of pressure on the cartilage in your knees without any release.
Synovial fluid is a harmful substance that can cause the cartilage in your joints to break down easily.
It is extremely important to avoid any weight-bearing exercise to protect your knee cartilage from all pressure.

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심 내용은 연골이 활액을 스펀지처럼 흡수하고 짜내는 과정을 통해, 걷기와 같은 활동에서 발생하는 변화하는 압력에 견딜 수 있다는 것입니다. 따라서 '연골은 마치 가정용 스펀지처럼 활액을 흡수하고 짜냄으로써 변화하는 압력을 견딘다'가 글의 요지로 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. ( ① ) ( ② ) This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure. ( ③ ) ( ④ ) ( ⑤ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage.**

options.text: ①
②
③
④
⑤

answer.explanation: 글의 흐름은 걷는 동작에 따른 압력 변화와 연골의 반응을 순서대로 설명합니다. 첫 번째 단계는 압력이 해제되어 연골이 활액을 '흡수'하는 것입니다. 주어진 문장은 그 다음 단계, 즉 다시 체중이 실려 압력이 가해질 때 활액이 '배출'되는 과정을 설명합니다. 이 두 과정(흡수와 배출)이 모두 설명된 후에야, 마지막 문장에서 'This squeezing of joint fluid into and out(이러한 관절액의 유입과 유출)'이라고 요약하며 그 기능을 설명할 수 있습니다. 따라서 주어진 문장은 ①에 들어가는 것이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street.

question_blocks.A: When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage.
question_blocks.B: When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water.
question_blocks.C: This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 무릎 연골의 중요성을 언급하며 상황을 설정합니다. (B)는 걷는 동작의 첫 단계로, 체중이 빠지면서 압력이 해제되고 연골이 활액을 흡수하는 과정을 설명합니다. (A)는 그 다음 단계로, 다시 체중이 실리면서 활액이 배출되는 과정을 설명합니다. 마지막으로 (C)는 'This squeezing... into and out'이라는 표현으로 (B)와 (A)의 과정을 요약하며, 이 메커니즘이 어떻게 압력에 대응하는지를 설명하며 결론을 맺습니다. 따라서 가장 자연스러운 순서는 (B)-(A)-(C)입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it [____________________] without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: grow much thicker
store fluid permanently
avoid all forms of pressure
respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking
release a chemical signal to the brain

answer.explanation: 빈칸이 있는 문장은 활액이 연골에 들어오고 나가는 과정의 결과를 설명합니다. 이 과정은 연골이 압력 속에서 부서지지 않도록 돕는다고 했습니다. 그 방법은 바로 '걷기 중에 가해졌다 사라졌다 하는 압력에 대응하는 것'입니다. 이 표현은 글 전체의 핵심 기능을 요약하는 것으로, 빈칸에 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the ① [healthy] functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is ② [released]. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge ③ [soaks up] liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes ④ [into] the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: ①
②
③
④
⑤

answer.explanation: 이 문장은 체중이 다시 실릴 때의 상황을 묘사합니다. 압력이 가해지면 연골에 흡수되었던 활액이 '밖으로(out of)' 짜내진다고 해야 합니다. '안으로(into)' 짜내진다는 것은 압력이 해제될 때의 상황과 같으므로, 압력이 가해지는 상황에 대한 설명으로는 모순됩니다. 따라서 'out of'가 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint (A) [bears weight], like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is (B) [released]. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge (C) [soaks up] liquid when put in water. When you take another step and (D) [transfer] the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without (E) [breaking] under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) bears weight: supports the mass or load of something
(B) released: allowed to move, act, or flow freely
(C) soaks up: absorbs liquid through a porous surface
(D) transfer: to move from one place to another
(E) breaking: improving in condition or quality

answer.explanation: (E) breaking은 이 문맥에서 압력으로 인해 '부서지는 것'을 의미합니다. 제시된 영영 풀이 'improving in condition or quality(상태나 질이 향상되는 것)'은 '개선되다'라는 의미로, 'breaking'의 의미와는 전혀 다릅니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is (A) [released / applied]. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes (B) [in / out] of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without (C) [breaking / healing] under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: released - out - breaking
released - in - healing
applied - out - breaking
applied - in - healing
released - out - healing

answer.explanation: (A) 체중을 다른 다리로 옮기면 무릎에 가해지던 압력은 '해제'되므로 'released'가 맞습니다. (B) 다시 체중이 실리면 활액은 연골 '밖으로' 짜내지므로 'out'이 적절합니다. (C) 이러한 과정은 연골이 압력 속에서 '부서지지' 않도록 돕는 것이므로 'breaking'이 맞습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment that you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge soaks up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it respond to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 글의 내용과 일치하지 않는 것은?

options.text: Cartilage is particularly important in weight-bearing joints.
When pressure on the knee is removed, cartilage absorbs fluid.
The function of cartilage is compared to that of a sponge.
When weight is put on the knee, fluid is also absorbed into the cartilage.
The fluid exchange helps cartilage withstand the pressure of walking.

answer.explanation: 본문은 'When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage'라고 명시하고 있습니다. 이는 체중이 실릴 때(압력이 가해질 때) 활액이 연골 '밖으로' 배출된다는 의미입니다. 따라서 활액이 흡수된다는 ④번 선택지는 글의 내용과 일치하지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: Cartilage is extremely important for the healthy functioning of a joint, especially if that joint bears weight, like your knee. Imagine for a moment ① [that / what] you're looking into the inner workings of your left knee as you walk down the street. When you shift your weight from your left leg to your right, the pressure on your left knee is released. The cartilage in your left knee then "drinks in" synovial fluid, in much the same way that a sponge ② [soaks / soaking] up liquid when put in water. When you take another step and transfer the weight back onto your left leg, much of the fluid squeezes out of the cartilage. This squeezing of joint fluid into and out of the cartilage helps it ③ [respond / to responding] to the off-and-on pressure of walking without breaking under the pressure.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 동사 'Imagine'의 목적어 역할을 하는 명사절을 이끌어야 합니다. 뒷문장 'you're looking...'은 완전한 문장이므로 접속사 'that'이 와야 합니다. 'what'은 뒷문장이 불완전할 때 사용됩니다.
접속사 'that'이 이끄는 절의 주어는 'a sponge'이므로, 동사는 3인칭 단수형인 'soaks'가 되어야 합니다.
준사역동사 'help'는 목적격 보어로 동사원형 또는 to부정사를 취할 수 있습니다. 따라서 'respond' 또는 'to respond'가 가능하며, 주어진 선택지 중 'respond'가 맞습니다. 동명사 'responding'은 올 수 없습니다.
